name: Hextris
overview: Hextris is a Tetris clone that was one of the many of this type of Amiga game to introduce hexagonal (beehive-shaped) blocks as the name suggests. The edges of the playing area are also hexagonal-shaped to fit the blocks. The game is more difficult as a result, since there are many more exposed edges that must fit with other tiles - five as opposed to three in a normal Tetris game. This version is by Ives Aerts and came out in 1992 and was for one or two players.
